name: Amazing Animals Multiple Choice Quiz | Miscellaneous Animal Trivia | 25 Questions

questions.text: Black eggs called caviar come from which fish?
questions.explanation: Sturgeon.

questions.text: What is Australia's tallest bird?
questions.explanation:
Emu.

	The ostrich comes from Africa.

questions.text: This flightless bird had no natural predators as it lived in a remote place. When Europeans came they brought rats, pigs and monkeys which ate its eggs and by 1680 they were extinct.
questions.explanation:
Dodo.

	The huge-beaked, turkey-sized dodo lived on the island of Mauritius.

questions.text: Name the strongest insect which can lift and support more than 800 times its own weight.
questions.explanation:
Rhinoceros beetle.

	It is also called the hercules beetle. The Goliath beetle is the heaviest insect.

questions.text: Name the largest living animal, which can grow to an average weight of 26 tonnes by the age of twelve months?
questions.explanation:
Blue whale.

	The adult female blue whale can measure 30 metres long and weigh over 150 tonnes.

questions.text: Which is the biggest fish?
questions.explanation:
Whale shark.

	The plankton-feeding whale shark can be 13 metres in length and is found in areas of the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian oceans.

questions.text: Name the largest rodent?
questions.explanation:
Capybara.

	The capybara of South America can weigh up to 174 pounds.

questions.text: On average, which of these is the longest member of the cat family?
questions.explanation:
Siberian tiger.

	The measurements are from the nose to the tip of the tail (In inches). The order of size is tiger (130), leopard (126), lion (110) and jaguar (107).

questions.text: Which of the following is the longest?
questions.explanation:
Saltwater crocodile.

	The komodo dragon is the largest lizard.

questions.text: Where would you find the world's smallest bird, the male bee hummingbird?
questions.explanation: Cuba.

questions.text: The cheetah is the fastest land mammal over a short distance of up to 600 yards but which animal is the fastest land mammal over long distances sustaining a speed of 35 m.p.h. for four miles?
questions.explanation: Pronghorn antelope.

questions.text: A type of boxfish has two spines above its eyes which give its name to which fish?
questions.explanation: Cowfish.

questions.text: Fossils show that coelacanths lived more than 300 million years ago and thought to have died out with the dinosaurs, 65 million years ago. In the 1930's they were discovered living in which ocean?
questions.explanation:
Indian.

	Off the coast of East Africa.

questions.text: Name the fish that has lacy fan-shaped fins which looks delicate but their spines can jab deadly poison?
questions.explanation: Lion fish.

questions.text: Name the fish which lives in shallow water among weed and rocks or partly buried in sand. If someone accidently steps on one, the small spines on its back contain one of the most powerful venoms in the whole animal kingdom?
questions.explanation: Stone fish.

questions.text: Why do many frogs and toads blow up their chin skin like a balloon?
options: To help breathe out of water
questions.explanation:
To make their calls louder.

	Male frogs and toads make loud calls to attract females.

questions.text: Where in the world can the smallest fish, dwarf gobies be found?
questions.explanation: Philippine Islands.

questions.text: Name the fish whose thick coating of slime protects it from the stinging paralyzing tentacles of sea anemones?
questions.explanation: Clown fish.

questions.text: What is the largest monkey?
questions.explanation:
Mandrill.

	Gorillas are apes and the largest of the primates.

questions.text: Sloths spend two-thirds of their time asleep. They feed on fruit and leaves while hanging from trees by long, hooked claws. How long does a meal take to pass through its body?
questions.explanation: Month.

questions.text: Which lizard runs so fast that it can even move for short distances over water because its long toes are supported by the skin-like film on the surface?
questions.explanation: Basilisk.

questions.text: Which male bird has a bright red balloon-like skin pouch on his throat which he blows up to attract a female?
questions.explanation: Frigatebird.

questions.text: Which land animal has the biggest eyes?
questions.explanation:
Ostrich.

	Each eye can be up to two inches in diameter. The tarsier has the biggest eyes among mammals but is only just over six inches in length.

questions.text: Which fish spends more time walking than swimming?
questions.explanation:
Batfish.

	The rosy-lipped batfish crawls well on its strong, leg-like fins.

questions.text: Which fish each night makes a bag-like cocoon of mucus slime around its body to protect it from predators while it sleeps?
questions.explanation:
Parrot fish.

	Many night-time predators hunt by smell rather than sight and the mucus makes it harder for them to smell the resting parrotfish. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
